tr.td:
Oncology Program / Programme d'oncologie
Diagnosis â€“ Cervical Cancer

td.b: Staging and treatment plan confirmed by:

tr.td:
Carcinoma is strictly confined to the cervix (extension to corpus should be disregarded)
IA Invasive carcinoma that can only be diagnosed by microscopy with deepest invasion â‰¤ 5 mm and largest extension â‰¤ 7mm
IB Clinical lesions confined to the cervix or preclinical lesions greater than IA

Carcinoma extends beyond cervix but has not extended to pelvic wall; it involves vagina, but not as far as the lower third
IIA No obvious parametrial invasion
IIB Obvious parametrial involvement

Carcinoma has extended to the pelvic wall; on rectal examination there is no cancer-free space between tumor and pelvic wall; tumor involves lower third of vagina; all cases with hydronephrosis or nonfunctioning kidney should be included, unless they are known to be due to another cause
IIIA No extension to pelvic wall, but involvement of lower third of vagina
IIIB Extension to pelvis wall and/or hydronephrosis or nonfunctioning kidney due to tumor

Carcinoma has extended beyond true pelvis or has clinically involved mucosa of bladded or rectum
IVA Spread of growth to adjacent pelvic organs
IVB Spread to distant organs

FIGO = International Federation of Obstetricians and Gynecologists
References: [1] Pecorelli S, Zigliani L, Odicino F. Revised FIGO staging for carcinoma of the cervix. Int J Gynecol Obstet 2009; (105) 107â€“108.
[2] Schorge J et al. (2012) Williams Gynecology, 2nd ed. Chapter 30: Cervical Cancer; McGraw Hill Professional: New York.

tr.th: This is a follow-up DST for (select reason):

Carcinoma is strictly confined to the cervix (extension to corpus should be disregarded)

IIIA No extension to pelvic wall, but involvement of lower third of vagina
IIIB Extension to pelvis wall and/or hydronephrosis or nonfunctioning kidney due to tumor

Carcinoma has extended beyond true pelvis or has clinically involved mucosa of bladded or rectum
IVA Spread of growth to adjacent pelvic organs

FIGO = International Federation of Obstetricians and Gynecologists
References: [1] Pecorelli S, Zigliani L, Odicino F. Revised FIGO staging for carcinoma of the cervix. Int J Gynecol Obstet 2009; (105) 107â€“108.
[2] Schorge J et al. (2012) Williams Gynecology, 2nd ed. Chapter 30: Cervical Cancer; McGraw Hill Professional: New York.
